display.text: Which component(s) of the circulatory system acts as a pump?

response.correctResponse: because blood needs a pump to circulate it
incorrectResponses: because blood must go back to the heart so the heart can receive blood also
because the blood needs to have the oxygen removed first (before it goes to the rest of the body)

display.text: Why doesn't oxygen rich blood flow directly from the lungs to the rest of the body?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*heart).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the heart.

display.clozeText: Which component(s) of the circulatory system acts as a pump?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*pump).*$|((?=.*mov)|(?=.*circul)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is because blood needs a pump to circulate it.

display.clozeText: Why doesn't oxygen rich blood flow directly from the lungs to the rest of the body?

display.text: Which type of blood vessel does blood flow through first when leaving the heart?

response.correctResponse: because arteries must withstand the high pressure of the blood coming directly from the pump/heart
incorrectResponses: because arteries carry blood with a very high concentration of oxygen
because arteries have muscles in their walls to pump blood
because arteries must contain (and control) more blood than other blood vessels

display.text: Why do the arteries have thicker walls than other blood vessels?

display.clozeText: Which type of blood vessel does blood flow through first when leaving the heart?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*pressure).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is because arteries must withstand the high pressure of blood coming directly from the heart/pump.

display.clozeText: Why do the arteries have thicker walls than other blood vessels?

display.text: Which type of blood vessel carries blood toward the heart?
What type of blood vessel would carry blood with the highest concentration of carbon dioxide?

display.clozeText: Which type of blood vessel carries blood toward the heart?
What type of blood vessel would carry blood with the highest concentration of carbon dioxide?

response.correctResponse: blood vessels closer to the heart are larger than those further away
incorrectResponses: blood vessels further away are bigger than those closer to the heart
blood vessels further away are double the size of those closer to the heart

display.text: What is the size difference between vessels close to the heart and those further away?
Where are the largest veins in the body located?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*small)((?=.*fur)|(?=.*far)|(?=.*away)).*$|((?=.*large)|(?=.*big))((?=.*close)|(?=.*near)|(?=.*around)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is blood vessels closer to the heart are larger than those further away.

display.clozeText: What is the size difference between vessels close to the heart and those further away?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*heart).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is near the heart.

display.clozeText: Where are the largest veins in the body located?

display.text: What are the top and bottom chambers of the heart called? Answer in that order.

response.correctResponse: two discharging chambers total, one per circle
incorrectResponses: four discharging chambers total, two per circle
four discharging chambers total, one per circle
two discharging chambers total, two per circle

display.text: How many discharging chamber(s) are there in the heart and how many discharging chamber(s) are there per circle of the circulatory system? Answer in that order.

response.correctResponse: (atri)(.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is atria and ventricles.

display.clozeText: What are the top and bottom chambers of the heart called? Answer in that order.

response.correctResponse: ((two)|(2))((.*one)|(.*1)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is two discharging chambers total, and one per circle.

display.clozeText: How many discharging chamber(s) are there in the heart and how many discharging chamber(s) are there per circle of the circulatory system? Answer in that order.

response.correctResponse: the vertical septum is solid and the horizontal septum has openings
incorrectResponses: ventricles are solid and atria have openings
all of the septums in the heart have openings
all of the septums in the heart are solid

display.text: Which of the septums in the heart is/are solid and which has/have openings? Answer in that order.
A defect called "hole in the heart" causes a hole to form in one of the septums of the heart. Which septum would this abnormality refer to?

response.correctResponse: ((.*vertic)|(.*ventricular)(.*atrial))(.*horizontal).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the vertical septum is solid and the horizontal septum has openings.

display.clozeText: Which of the septums in the heart is/are solid and which has/have openings? Answer in that order.

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*vertic)|(?=.*ventric)|(?=.*atrial)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is vertical septum.

display.clozeText: A defect called "hole in the heart" causes a hole to form in one of the septums of the heart. Which septum would this abnormality refer to?

display.text: How many circles are there in the circulatory system?

response.correctResponse: it pumps blood out for both circles (out of the left side and out of the right side).
incorrectResponses: It pumps twice as much blood
It pumps blood into the heart and out of the heart
It pumps oxygen to parts of the body and also pumps blood to other parts

display.text: What does it mean that the heart is a ""double-pump""?

display.clozeText: How many circles are there in the circulatory system?

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*oxy)(?=.*carbon dio)).*$|((?=.*circle)|(?=.*cycle))|((?=.*left)(?=.*right)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is it pumps blood out for both circles (out of the left side and out of the right side).

display.clozeText: What does it mean that the heart is a ""double-pump""?
The ____ side of the heart receives blood from the veins and pumps it to ____.

response.correctResponse: the left atrium and left ventricle
incorrectResponses: the right atrium and right ventricle

display.text: Blood with a high concentration of oxygen is sometimes referred to as "fresh blood." Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain fresh blood?

response.correctResponse: (right)((.*lung)|(.*pulmon)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is right, the lungs.

display.clozeText: The ____ side of the heart receives blood from the veins and pumps it to ____.

response.correctResponse: (?=.*right).*$~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left atrium and left ventricle.;(?=.*left)(?=.*atri)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left atrium and left ventricle.

display.clozeText: Blood with a high concentration of oxygen is sometimes referred to as "fresh blood." Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain fresh blood?
The ___ side of the heart receives blood from the lungs and pumps  it to _____.

response.correctResponse: the right atrium and right ventricle
incorrectResponses: the left atrium and left ventricle

display.text: Blood with a high concentration of carbon dioxide is a dark red color. Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain dark red blood?

response.correctResponse: (left)((.*body)|(.*systemic)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is left, the body.

display.clozeText: The ___ side of the heart receives blood from the lungs and pumps  it to _____.

response.correctResponse: (?=.*right)(?=.*atri)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the right atrium and right ventricle.

display.clozeText: Blood with a high concentration of carbon dioxide is a dark red color. Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain dark red blood?

display.text: In the heart, what physically separates the two circles of the circulatory system?

response.correctResponse: so that the oxygen-rich blood and carbon dioxide-rich blood do not mix
incorrectResponses: so the circles don't get to bunched up together
so that the correct amount of blood is pumped
so that the circles are kept separated to the right and left side of the body

display.text: Why is it important for the two circles of the circulatory system physically separated from each other?

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*vertical)|(?=.*atrial)|(?=.*ventricular))((?=.*sept)|(?=.*wall)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is vertical septum.

display.clozeText: In the heart, what physically separates the two circles of the circulatory system?

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*mix)|(?=.*combin)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is so that the oxygen-rich blood and carbon dioxide-rich blood do not mix.

display.clozeText: Why is it important for the two circles of the circulatory system physically separated from each other?

display.text: Blood is sent to various parts of the body from which specific  chamber of the heart?

response.correctResponse: the left ventricle because it propels blood to the rest of the body
incorrectResponses: the right atrium because they receives large amounts of blood
the left and right ventricles because they are closer to the chest and need more protection
The left atrium and left ventricle because they have oxygen-rich blood.

display.text: Which specific chamber(s) of the heart would need the thickest (strongest) walls and why?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*left)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is left ventricle.

display.clozeText: Blood is sent to various parts of the body from which specific  chamber of the heart?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*left )(?=.*ventric)((?=.*propel)|(?=.*pump))((?=.*body)|(?=.*systemic)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left ventricle because it must propel blood to the rest of the body.

display.clozeText: Which specific chamber(s) of the heart would need the thickest (strongest) walls and why?

response.correctResponse: Blood delivers oxygen and removes carbon dioxide
incorrectResponses: Blood offers protection from infection and temperature regulation
Blood is responsible for communication and transportation
Blood moves cells and keeps the heart pumping

display.text: In terms of interacting with the cells of the body, blood serves what two functions?

response.correctResponse: provides nutrients and eliminates toxins through gas exchange
incorrectResponses: provides pressure to keep the blood vessels in place
provides a pump through wave motion

display.text: Some aquatic species do not have circulatory systems because the water around them essentially serves the same function as the human circulatory system. What function would the water around them serve?

response.correctResponse: (?=((.*tak)|(.*rid)|(.*remov)).*(carbon diox))(?=((.*bring)|(.*deliver)|(.*giv)|(.*suppl)).*(oxy))|(?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is blood delivers oxygen and removes carbon dioxide.

display.clozeText: In terms of interacting with the cells of the body, blood serves what two functions?

response.correctResponse: (?=((.*tak)|(.*rid)|(.*remov)).*(carbon diox))(?=((.*bring)|(.*deliver)|(.*giv)|(.*suppl)).*(oxy))|(?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is provides nutrients and eliminates toxins through gas exchange.

incorrectResponses: so that the blood can flow through them more quickly
because capillaries must reach tiny parts of the body

display.clozeText: Which blood vessel allows oxygen and carbon dioxide to pass in and out?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*$|(?=.*oxy)(?=.*carbon dio).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is to allow for gas e xchange.

display.text: What is the first part of the heartbeat?

response.correctResponse: it would lower the heart rate because the heart can pump more blood with each contraction
incorrectResponses: it would increase the heart rate because the heart is strong enough to pump blood at a faster rate
it would lower the heart rate because it takes more effort to contract the large muscles
it would increase the heart rate because the rest of the body would likely also be strong, and need more blood/oxygen

display.text: What effect would stronger heart muscle have on a person's heart rate and why?

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*contract)|(?=.*squeez)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the heart muscles contracting.

display.clozeText: What is the first part of the heartbeat?

response.correctResponse: (?=.*more)((?=.*low)|(?=.*decrease))((?=.*pump)|(?=.*beat)|(?=.*contract)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is it would lower the heart rate because the heart can pump more blood with each contraction.

display.clozeText: What effect would stronger heart muscle have on a person's heart rate and why?

display.text: Which part of the heart contracts first in each heartbeat?

response.correctResponse: the right atrium would contract at the same time as the left atrium
incorrectResponses: the right atrium would contract before the left atrium
the right atrium would contract after the left atrium
the right atrium does not contract

display.text: If the left atrium is contracting now, when does the right atrium contract?

display.clozeText: Which part of the heart contracts first in each heartbeat?

response.correctResponse: ((?=.*now)|(?=.*same)|(?=.*during)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is at the same time.

display.clozeText: If the left atrium is contracting now, when does the right atrium contract?

display.text: What prevents blood from flowing backward in the heart?

Blood in the legs that is flowing back to the heart is moving against gravity (i.e., it's trying to flow up). The pressure of the heart pumping prevents the blood from flowing downward, but what other component of the circulatory system could work here to prevent the blood from flowing downward/ backward?

display.clozeText: What prevents blood from flowing backward in the heart?

Blood in the legs that is flowing back to the heart is moving against gravity (i.e., it's trying to flow up). The pressure of the heart pumping prevents the blood from flowing downward, but what other component of the circulatory system could work here to prevent the blood from flowing downward/ backward?

display.text: Age?
Gender?
Which is the highest level of education you have completed?

Do you now, or have you ever, worked in a profession that dealt with knowledge of the circulatory system?

For example, if you have ever worked in any of the following jobs, you should select "Yes": nurse, EMT, student majoring in biology, teaching 12th grade anatomy, etc.

Examples of professions that would require you to select "No" include: Mathematics teacher, Student majoring in Psychology or Political Science, US Postal Service, etc.
